Pareto Documentation

Created on Thu Mar 13 10:22:35 2025

author:

tghosh

pareto.build_co_product_dictionary(data: DataFrame) → dict[source]

Create a dictionary of co-product relationships from the data.

The dictionary keys are unique identifiers and the values are sorted lists of co-product names.

Parameters:

data (pd.DataFrame) -- DataFrame containing production process data with co-product information.

Returns:

A dictionary mapping unique process keys to a list of associated co-products.

Return type:

dict

pareto.build_equation_dataframe(model, data: DataFrame) → DataFrame[source]

Link model decision variables (x) to the underlying DataFrame for physical flows.

This function creates a DataFrame that connects each pathway (identified by its name) with its corresponding Pyomo decision variable and then merges it with the original data. It also computes derived metrics such as product flow, price, GHG emissions, and other impacts.

Parameters:

  • model -- The Pyomo model containing the decision variables.

  • data (pd.DataFrame) -- DataFrame with process data and associated parameters.

Returns:

A DataFrame containing the linked variables and computed metrics.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

pareto.create_metrics(metrics: list, equation_dataframe: DataFrame) → list[source]

Create the objective function for a given metric.

Aggregates the specified metric over all products to produce an overall objective value.

Parameters:

  • metrics (list) -- List of metric names; only the first metric is used.

  • equation_dataframe (pd.DataFrame) -- DataFrame containing calculated process metrics.

Returns:

A list containing the total metric value and the metric name.

Return type:

list

pareto.load_and_filter_data(yr: int, trl: bool) → DataFrame[source]

Load the main 'full_data.csv' dataset and filter it if TRL is True.

Parameters:

  • yr (int) -- The target year (not used for filtering in the current implementation).

  • trl (bool) -- Boolean flag indicating whether to filter for high TRL data.

Returns:

A pandas DataFrame containing the loaded (and possibly filtered) data.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

pareto.load_constraint_data(yr: int) → tuple[DataFrame, DataFrame][source]

Load additional constraint data for feedstock availability and product demand.

Parameters:

yr (int) -- The target year for which constraints are to be loaded.

Returns:

A tuple where the first element is a DataFrame of feedstock limits and the second is a DataFrame of product demand limits.

Return type:

tuple[pd.DataFrame, pd.DataFrame]

pareto.multiobjective_optimization(constrained_metric, metrics, yr, trl, fix_2030_results)[source]

Perform multi-objective optimization using Pyomo.

This function sets up and solves an optimization model by:

  1. Loading and preprocessing data.

  2. Defining decision variables and constraints.

  3. Deriving a constrained metric and adding its constraint.

  4. Setting the objective function based on the provided metric.

  5. Solving the model and performing post-processing to output results.

Parameters:

  • constrained_metric (list) -- List containing the metric to be constrained and its limit.

  • metrics (list) -- List containing the metric(s) used for the objective; only the first metric is used.

  • yr (int) -- The target year for constraints.

  • trl (bool) -- Boolean flag indicating whether to filter for high TRL data.

  • fix_2030_results (bool) -- Boolean flag determining if 2030 results should be fixed.

Returns:

A tuple with: - The final equation DataFrame containing calculated flows and metrics. - The aggregated feedstock DataFrame. - The complete product DataFrame.

Return type:

tuple[pd.DataFrame, pd.DataFrame, pd.DataFrame]

pareto.product_dataframe_editor(product_df: DataFrame, equation_df: DataFrame, main_product_df: DataFrame) → DataFrame[source]

Adjust the product DataFrame to account for intermediate feedstocks that are also products in a previous step (negative flow represents consumption).

Parameters:

  • product_df (pd.DataFrame) -- DataFrame containing product flow data.

  • equation_df (pd.DataFrame) -- DataFrame linking process pathways with model variables.

  • main_product_df (pd.DataFrame) -- DataFrame that flags main-product processes.

Returns:

The adjusted product DataFrame with corrected flow signs.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

pareto.reduce_extra_production(demand_summed: DataFrame, yr: int) → float[source]

Calculate the total excess production beyond the demanded quantity.

Excess production is defined as the difference between actual product flow and the demand by society.

Parameters:

  • demand_summed (pd.DataFrame) -- DataFrame containing aggregated product flow and demand data.

  • yr (int) -- The target year for demand constraints.

Returns:

The total excess production.

Return type:

float

pareto.sum_co_products(df: DataFrame) → DataFrame[source]

Adjust feedstock usage based on co-product fractions.

This function computes the total product flow by summing co-product amounts and adjusts the main product mass fraction, total feedstock inflow, and the resulting product yield per unit feedstock.

Parameters:

df (pd.DataFrame) -- DataFrame containing feedstock and co-product usage data.

Returns:

The modified DataFrame with additional computed columns.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame
